task_description: Facing the building to your North-East (approx. 64°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to look up to see the full height of the building since my current pitch is level with the horizon.
I need to adjust my position to get a better perspective of the building's height, moving to the front-left might help.
I need to rotate to the right to align my view with the building's direction for a better height estimation.
I need to look up again to see the top of the building for a complete height estimation.
I need to move forward to get closer to the building for a better perspective on its height.
I should move forward again to get even closer to the building for a more accurate height estimation.
I need to look down to see the base of the building for a complete height estimation from ground to roof.
I now have a view of both the base and the top of the building, allowing me to estimate its height.
